text: Brickellia seemannii is a Mexican species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It is native to northwestern Mexico in the state of Sinaloa.Turner, B. L. 1997. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 1 – Eupatorieae. Phytologia Memoirs 11: i–iv, 1–272Blake, Sydney Fay 1926. Contributions from the United States National Herbarium 23(5): 1481 description in English, as Coleosanthus seemannii The species is named for German botanist Berthold Carl Seemann, 1825 - 1871.Gray, Asa. 1879. Proceedings of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences 15: 30-31, in footnotes description in Latin, commentary in English The species inhabits terrestrial environments. ==References== seemannii Category:Flora of Sinaloa Category:Plants described in 1879
title: Brickellia seemannii
